dialogues.text: (under his breath) Decoy. A fuckin' decoy. (louder) The whole thing's a fake. He snookered us. TIGHT ON Cahill's sweating face.

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: (near hysteria) What?! What's happening?! What the hell's happening?

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY
dialogues.text: A decoy, to waste our time. The real works must be below, under the plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barry and Grant, listening to Cappy's devastating news.

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Real cute, this guy. Built a decoy into the system. Time you finish fiddle-fucking around, the timer would have gone off. Cahill's screw-up probably saved us a lot of time.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: (agitated) Just give it to me straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cahill is staring at the bomb as he listens to the exchange between Grant and Cappy. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY
dialogues.text: We'll have to start over. Cahill, leans back, his head bumping the wall of the container.

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: (exhaling) Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Rat's watch. In anger, Rat slams his fist into his hand. He seems near the breaking point.

dialogues.speaker: RAT
dialogues.text: Jesus, we've got less than fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) I'm sorry, that's all we can do. I can't say what we'll find.

dialogues.speaker: RAT
dialogues.text: Then we go now, blow the lights, take our chances.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (urgent) No. He just ran another test. He's got direct access to the thing. It's got to be by total surprise or you're fucked. Rat leans back against the bulkhead, closing his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RAT
dialogues.text: We're not going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks around him, at Baker, at his face, tired and haggard. He looks defeated. Slowly a new energy and resolve begins to show on Grant's face.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: He's not going to beat us. We've come too far. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He keys the mike to his head set.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: (determined) Get into your attack positions. Cappy, stay with it. We're taking this thing to the wire.

dialogues.speaker: RAT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What about the sleeper?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: I'll take care of the sleeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cahill, wide-eyed with concentration and fear, is lifting the top panel of the bomb containing the false circuitry.

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY
dialogues.text: Easy. Not too fast. Now hold it, don't move. Cahill holds the panel just inches above the top frame- work of the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY
dialogues.text: Knowing how this fucker thinks, I expect he's got a surprise for us. Check under the panel with your light. Look for something connecting the two panels, a trip- wire maybe. Holding the panel steady, Cahill lowers his head, using the light on his head gear to scan between the two levels the second level consisting of a series of relays and a softball-sized stainless steel sphere. He scans the area, seeing a hair-fine wire, attached to the top panel and below, to a micro-switch.

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: (trembling) You're right. There's a wire... hooked to a switch.

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY
dialogues.text: That's it. Now just reach in with your nippers and clip that wire. Cahill, holding the panel with one hand, fumbles for the nippers in the tool kit. Moving them into position he cuts the wire.  196 197 198 199 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Baker are intently studying the monitor, traine on the mid-cabin work station. Through the wide-angle lens, we can see Fran, slowly moving down the aisle towards the station.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Come on, keep coming... In his hand he nervously holds the makeshift switch connected to the cabin phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As four F-14's descend from the clouds, dropping in behin the 747. They pull alongside, two in front, two in the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOT and his NAVIGATOR are clearly seen as they look towards the 747.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) CSA Flight 343. This is flight leader, U. S. Navy aircraft. You are approaching United States air space. You are to divert immediately to three-seven-zero North for Gander Air Force Base. If you do not comply, we are ordered to open fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Baker respond in shock as they listen to this late development over the monitor they have installed to the ship's radio receiver.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER
dialogues.text: Captain...

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: I know, we're in deep shit. We've got to stop them. (thinks ) I need a schematic of the plane. Baker turns, digging through one of their satchels. He removes a complicated schematic of the 747, showing the hundreds of miles of electrical wiring, hydraulic lines and servos. Grant desperately begins tracking something on the schematic.  200 201 202 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew and the Terrorist Guard listen in stunned silence as the F-14's demands are repeated.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) ... Repeat, you must divert to 0370 immediately, or we will open fire. Squawk 433 for acknowledgement.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. What the hell are they doing? They can't mean that. He turns to the Terrorist.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: We have to respond. You heard what they said. The Terrorist points his pistol at the Pilot.

dialogues.speaker: TERRORIST
dialogues.text: You will say nothing. You will stay on course. The Terrorist picks up a phone, pressing the buzzer. He speaks in Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: TERRORIST
dialogues.text: (subtitles) Ali. Fighter planes. They say they will shoot if we do not turn away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali Hassan is listening to the Terrorist's report. He slams down the phone and moves towards the forward section, a look of wild rage and anger on his face. We GO WITH him as he moves towards the forward section, HOLDING ON the Air Marshal, who, seeing the disturbed look on Ali's face, carefully reaches down, removing his revolver from his boot, hiding it under his thigh. By his expression we can see he is trying to formulate some kind of attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant at the electronics bulkhead, removing several panels. He pulls out a massive wiring harness, searching through the multi-colored wires.  203 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cahill is removing the last of several screws from a circular inspection plate on the side of the steel sphere

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY
dialogues.text: Now, attach the grip. Cahill unfolds a small tripod, supporting a shaft with a suction cup at one end. He places the tripod over the sphere gently pressing the suction cup over the cover.

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY
dialogues.text: Now back off, just a hair. Just enough to see if it's friendly. Cahill swallows hard, takes a deep breath and turns the reverse-screw mechanism at the top of the tripod, lifting the cover a fraction of an inch. He stops, using a tiny penlight and a dentist's mirror to examine the edges and the back side of the plate.

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: Can't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY
dialogues.text: Okay, back it off a little more. Cahill slowly removes the cover, revealing the interior of the hollow sphere, at the bottom of which is a tiny brass armature situated above a steel contact point, similar to that in an automobile distributor.

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY
dialogues.text: Don't touch anything. Let me see those points. Cahill adjusts the mirror, holding a magnifying glass over the sphere, focusing it for Cappy.

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY
dialogues.text: Looks clear. Don't think Mr. X expected us to get this far. But you need something thin and non- metallic to slip between those points. Cahill searches through the kit but can't find anything plastic. He reaches into his pocket, pulling out a handful of cocktail napkins, paper, etc. He finds a plastic coffee straw. Slitting the straw with a knife he holds it out, ready to insert it between the points. Cahill turns back to the sphere with the plastic strip, taking a deep breath. But suddenly he stops. Cahill looks up at Cappy in the mirror. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: But what if he did, Cappy? What if he did expect us to get this far. Why quit now? Cappy smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY
dialogues.text: Good call. You're starting to think like me. (beat) In the kit, there should be a pair of infra-red goggles. Find em. Cahill searches through the tool kit, putting on a pair of infra-red goggles, plugging a power cable into the battery unit. He lowers the goggles into place, switching them on.

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: (whispered) Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY
dialogues.text: That bad, huh?

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR OF SPHERE 203A
dialogues.text: Through the infra-red spectrum, we see that the points ar protected by a spider-web maze of hair-fine photo-electri light beams.

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: That bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Baker are hearing the TRANSMISSION from the cockpit, Grant still frantically working away at wiring harness, his face dripping with sweat. He has ten or twelve wires bunched in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali Hassan is on the radio-phone, talking to Washington.

dialogues.speaker: ALI HASSAN
dialogues.text: ... Why we are being threatened? our terms are absolute. The release of Jaffa for half the hostages. No compromises. No tricks.  206 207 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaplan and his crisis team are seated at the massive table, listening in rapt silence to the demands of Ali Hassan. Kaplan is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KAPLAN
dialogues.text: We have already met your first condition and are willing to comply with the rest of your demands. But for security reasons, we must insist that the exchange take place...

dialogues.speaker: ALI HASSAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) You will insist nothing! Tell your President he will comply or suffer the blood of many Americans on this plane. Beginning now. The President looks to the Major-General.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR-GENERAL
dialogues.text: This may have been a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: KAPLAN
dialogues.text: We just can't shoot them down without a warning.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 747
dialogues.text: Ali Hassan leaves the cockpit, entering the business class. He grabs a male PASSENGER, pushing him into the cockpit. He forces the man to his knees, holding the pistol to his head. With his other hand he holds the radio-phone to the man's face.

dialogues.speaker: ALI HASSAN
dialogues.text: Talk to your President. Beg him for your life. Tell him who you are. Speak!

dialogues.speaker: PASSENGER
dialogues.text: (terrified) Please... My name is Stanley Fisher... I have a wife and three children. (chokes ) He's holding a gun to my head. Please, do what they want...  111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaplan and his team sit transfixed in horror as they listen to the man's desperate pleadings.

dialogues.speaker: PASSENGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Please... I don't want to die... Suddenly, two SHOTS are heard OVER the SPEAKERS. A long pause and then...

dialogues.speaker: PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My, God, no...

dialogues.speaker: ALI HASSAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) This plane is to continue on as planned or I will kill another passenger every minute.

dialogues.speaker: KAPLAN
dialogues.text: We've got to end this. Order the attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Navigator is talking to his Pilot, his eyes intense.

dialogues.speaker: NAVIGATOR
dialogues.text: Bull, we can't do this. Warning them off is one thing... that's a civilian aircraft, full of Americans.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: It's a Presidential order, Spider, there must be a damned good reason for it.

dialogues.speaker: NAVIGATOR
dialogues.text: I sure hope to hell there is. Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Formation, this is Bulldog. I'm assuming attack position, everyone else back off and stand clear. Climb to thirty-five thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they peel off, three of the jets climb to higher elevation while the lead jet falls in behind the 747.  211 212 213 214 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is tearing open an electrical panel, exposing a sea of wires. He stares at the wires, wipes the sweat from his eyes and makes a move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now trailing two miles behind the 747. On the control panel we see the heads-up display of the 747 as the targeting sight swings into position and centers. A SHRILL TONE is heard, indicating missile lock.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Nav Com, this is Bulldog. I have missile lock. Request final confirmation of orders, over.

dialogues.speaker: NAV COM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bulldog, this is Nav Com. Proceed as ordered.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Roger, Nav Com. Stand by.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT'S HAND
dialogues.text: as he flips the firing selector to missile. His finger begins to close on the trigger...

dialogues.speaker: COCKPIT DISPLAY
dialogues.text: the target center holding on the 747... Suddenly, the navigation lights on the dark 747 flash on and hold.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: The nav-lights just came on. Suddenly the lights begin to flash, on and off, on and off, in a steady sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant has cut the bundle of wires leading to the nav- lights and is now touching them together, apart, together

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The F-14 growing closer to the 747, the nav-lights still flashing. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Spider, is that what I think it is?

dialogues.speaker: NAVIGATOR
dialogues.text: You damned right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaplan and the crisis team are staring at the overhead screen, awaiting the word of the 747's destruction. The room is dead silent. A voice breaks in over the speakers, startling them.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Nav Com, this is Bulldog. We have an unusual communication from the target.

dialogues.speaker: NAV COM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Bulldog, this is Nav Com. Specify transmission. Over.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Bulldog. Seems to be Morse code coming from the navigation lights. Message as follows: Hail Mary... Ten minutes.' Message repeats. Over. Stunned, Kaplan drops into his seat.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: They made it...

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR-GENERAL
dialogues.text: I'll be a son-of-a-bitch.

dialogues.speaker: DCI
dialogues.text: But it's too late. They've already crossed the line, they're into U.S. airspace. With every minute...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: They made it this far, and by-God I'm going to give them another ten minutes. General, get on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is still sending his coded message, sparks flying from the bus bar. Over the 747's radio we hear the F-14 Pilot's voice.

dialogues.speaker: F-14 PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Flight 343, this is Navy flight leader. We are to provide you with an escort to Dulles International. Grant stops his signalling.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: We've got ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant turns to Baker.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Get in position. We're going in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: BAKER
dialogues.text: What about the sleeper?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Time we got acquainted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the infra-red spectrum, Cahill is attempting to weave the plastic straw through the first of the light beams. He stops, withdraws the straw and wipes the sweat from his face. He picks up the straw and placing a bend in it, begins to maneuver it through and around the light beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is now alone, watching the monitor of the mid-cabin area work station.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Come on... Fran and two other attendants are sitting in their jump seats, a Terrorist standing guard in the entrance, his back to them. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grant is pressing a switch, the flasher on the phone in the work station responding. Fran looks up, seeing the light. But she obviously doesn't know what to do. The light continues to flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashing light on the phone is becoming more urgent. Quietly, Fran rises and lifts the phone from its cradle, the Terrorist Guard still with his back to her. Her crew mates stare at her in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered; urgent) I need your help. The lower galley. Do exactly as I say. Turn around and enter the elevator. The lives of everyone on this plane depend upon what you do. Right now. She quietly hangs up the phone and turns, looking into the eyes of her frightened crew mates. She looks at the elevator a few steps away. With a determined look she moves forward, opening the door and stepping inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fran carefully closes the door. She turns, staring at the overhead control buttons. Her finger touches the down switch. The elevator activates, MOTORS WHINING as it descends into the lower galley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing the sound of the ELEVATOR, Ali turns, seeing that Fran is gone. He looks at the red light over the elevator. He gestures to the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: (subtitles) Kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fran emerges from the elevator. Suddenly, Grant is behind her, his hand over her mouth. He turns her around, their eyes meeting. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The ELEVATOR ACTIVATES, lifting up to the main floor.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: No sound. Sit over there, put your head down, like you're crying. Do it, now. She moves to the opposite bulkhead, pulling down the jumpseat. The MOTORS WHINE again as the elevator begins to lower. The door opens and the Terrorist emerges. Seeing Fran sitting across from him, he raises his weapon to fire. A voice from behind calls out:

dialogues.speaker: GRANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! Startled, the Terrorist turns, facing Grant, aiming a .22 silenced pistol at him. The Terrorist starts to move and Grant FIRES, TWICE, two tiny red holes appearing in the Terrorist's head. He falls to the floor in a heap. Grant is stunned, momentarily overcome by what he has just done Fran stares back at him, realizing this is not a cold- blooded killer. He looks at her as if asking for help and then kneels, stripping the Terrorist of his clothes. He looks at Fran.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: The man in 148... we're going to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: FRAN
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do? He stares at her, fear in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Help me get close enough to kill him. Grant continues to strip the clothes from the Terrorist.

dialogues.speaker: OF SPHERE
dialogues.text: as Cahill continues, painfully, inch by inch, to move the plastic strip towards the armature.  225 226 117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, now dressed in the terrorist's clothing, is speak- ing on his headset.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: We're ready...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Here's how it goes: soon as you hit the sleeper, it's lights out and we go. We're on infra-red. The plane's system will kick the lights back on in six seconds, that's all the surprise we've got. Make it count. Grant lays down the headset, pulling Fran into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaplan and his team are watching the situation map, show- ing the 747's position, relative to the U.S. coast-line, the F-14's tracking the jet, and a flashing, fail-safe line, indicating that the 747 has already crossed the point where it was determined it must be destroyed. The elapsed time clock indicates six minutes remaining on the additional ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR-GENERAL
dialogues.text: They'll be starting their descent in about ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: DCI
dialogues.text: At thirty-five thousand feet our loses would be minimal. Every thousand feet of descent, the death toll from fallout will increase dramatically. (beat) I pray you've made the right decision. Kaplan continues to stare at the situation map. As he does, we PAN DOWN TO the table, to the open folder, the one previously given to Kaplan by the Arab diplomat. We SLOWLY PUSH IN ON a photograph of a man, early fifties fair complextion, balding, with cold, intense eyes. It is a face we have never seen before, certainly not the man in 148-B.  227 228 229 230 118.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 747
dialogues.text: The dark-complected man in 148-B looks cautiously around him pushing his computer deeper into the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant emerges from the elevator, pushing Fran as if she were his prisoner. Holding the automatic weapon in his left hand as a shield across his face, we see that in his right hand he is holding the .22 Beretta, flat against her back.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: (whisper) Just keep walking. Eyes straight ahead. When I push you, hit the floor and stay down. Fran moves forward, her face frozen with fear. They enter the aisle, moving towards the man at the window, his head barely visible some ten rows away. On the other side of the cabin, the Terrorist Guard sees them, but as he can only view Grant from the rear, he continues on his patrol. Grant focuses his attention on the man, now seven rows away. But he fails to see the Terrorist on patrol in the next section aft, moving AWAY FROM us and towards the work station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the intensity of a jeweler about to cut the Hope Diamond, Cahill guides the plastic straw close to the open points, through the deadly, complicated maze of light beams.

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: (to himself) Little more, little more... light as a feather. Come on up, Leroy, you're all mine... easy now. In CLOSEUP we see that Cahill is almost to the points with the plastic strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is now only three rows away. As he takes the last step he pushes Fran aside, spins around, leveling the pistol directly at the man's face. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We RACK FOCUS OVER the gunsights of the pistol INTO the paralyzed face of the man in 148-B. Grant's finger touches the trigger and then, stops... Grant stares at the man, seeing him for the first time, focusing on his eyes, the trembling lip and the unmistak- able fear and utter confusion of an innocent man. Grant spins back to the aisle, meeting Fran's stunned expression.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: It's not him... Grant reaches across the seats, grabbing the computer, yanking it towards him. As he does, the computer smashes into the seat back, the battery pack splitting open, a flood of glittering diamonds, cascading over Grant's leg and onto the floor. Grant drops the computer, his eyes whipping across the sea of faces before him -- who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cahill inching closer to the points with the plastic strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the next section aft, alerted by the commotion, the Terrorist Guard has moved through the work station and seeing Grant's face in profile, raises his weapon to fire Grant still unaware of his presence. Suddenly, the Air Marshal springs like a jack-in-the-box from his seat, a .357 revolver held in combat stance. Grant reacts, raising his weapon...

dialogues.speaker: AIR MARSHAL
dialogues.text: (shouting) Behind you! The Marshal FIRES, the terrorist guard ripped off his feet, slammed into the seats, but FIRING back as he falls the Marshal hit, spinning, dropping. Chaos spreads through the passengers, Grant still probing, searching th faces before him. Suddenly his eyes make contact and lock onto a face, a man seated in an aisle seat on the opposit side of the plane and several rows forward... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We CRASH ZOOM IN ON the face, the face of the man on the photograph! Grant has found his man. He points his weapon, shouting...

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Freeze! Suddenly, like a flushed quail, the man panics, reaching for something wedged between his jacket and the seat. But his fingers fumble the object, which falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Everybody, down! As the man lurches to the floor, Grant FIRES, the BULLET EXPLODING into the headrest. Grant plants his foot on an armrest and in a wild, crawling scramble across the center section seats, races desperately to beat the man to the detonator. On the floor, the sleeper, with trembling hands, flips open the lid to a six-inch square calculator-like device, rapidly punching in a four-digit code. Grant, in a last desperate lunge, goes airborne in SLOW MOTION, twisting and FIRING as he clears the last row of seats, delivering a fatal head shot to the sleeper, just as the sleeper's finger touches the detonation switch!

dialogues.speaker: ARMATURE
dialogues.text: ROARING down towards the contact point, crushing down on the very tip of the plastic straw. Cahill's face in total shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights trip off as the circuit breaker is blown, leaving everything in semi-darkness. Passengers scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baker kicks open the storage doors in the nose, bursting into the room.

dialogues.speaker: IN INFRA-RED 235A
dialogues.text: as he races towards the startled Terrorist. Baker FIRES his TASER UNIT, the deadly barb hurtling towards the Terrorist's chest...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 235B
dialogues.text: The Terrorist throws up his hands, reacting in an electrical spasm as he is hit by the taser, his body surrounded by a blue-white glow of static-electricity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ceiling panels disintegrate as they are blown apart, a powerful flash illuminating the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rat kicks through the sleeper doors behind the business class seats.

dialogues.speaker: IN INFRA-RED 237A
dialogues.text: as Ali Hassan and his partner turn in shock. Rat FIRES the STUN-GUN, the projectile mushrooming into a pancake- sized disc which slams into Ali Hassan's chest, driving him backwards into the cockpit. With his other hand, Rat FIRES a TASER UNIT into the chest of the other Terrorist, electrocuting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie drops through the hole in the ceiling in silhouette, landing in a crouch as the lights flash back on. Charlie recovers and stands, FIRING his hand SHOTGUN, point-blank at the Terrorist in the aisleway, spinning to take out another with his pistol. The Terrorist is knocked sideways against the seats, his finger closing on the trigger of his AUTOMATIC WEAPON, letting loose a BURST which rakes across the cabin, SHATTERING TWO WINDOWS. An incredible EXPLOSION RIPS THROUGH the PLANE as the aircraft depressurizes, a portion of the hull is ripped away like paper, in an instant two rows of seats vanishin in a gaping hole... Oxygen masks drop as overhead bins erupt, the cabin becoming a hurricane of RUSHING WIND, the plane plummet- ing into a steep dive, the air filled with paper, debris, blankets, food trays, luggage and other flying objects. Charlie is sucked off his feet and slammed against the wall near the gaping hole where the windows used to be. Several passengers grab him, preventing him from going out the window. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Baker, racing down the aisle is also ripped off his feet by the implosion, hurling him over several seats and into the wall. He falls, clinging to the seats. Grant, moving towards the Terrorist in the rear is knocke to the floor by the blast of air rushing past him. As he falls, he is hit by a briefcase, knocking the pistol from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rat is sucked off his feet and pulled down the stairwell amid a whirlpool of rushing air and debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain grabs the yokes as the plane noses over into a steep dive.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: We're losing control! The Pilot and First Officer frantically fight to regain control of the plunging airplane.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 747
dialogues.text: Lurches into a radical dive, SCREAMING towards the ocean below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cahill is thrown from the baggage container, across the room, an avalanche of baggage covering him, Cappy's stretcher plunging backwards into the container at a near forty-five, Cappy's head coming to rest, inches from the bomb, his good arm pinned beneath his body. Cappy looks up at the bomb as we: ZOOM IN CLOSE ON the bomb, the plastic straw, still trapped between the points by a mere millimeter beginning to vibrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali Hassan struggles to his feet. Although bleeding severely from the mouth and suffering severe internal injuries from the stun-gun, he struggles on, crazed and unstoppable. He moves to the stairwell. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rat is fighting to pull himself back up the railing when he looks up, seeing Ali Hassan above him. Before he can react, Ali Hassan FIRES his 9mm HANDGUN, the impact of the bullet knocking Rat down the stairs. Ali Hassan follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inches from Cappy's eyes the plastic straw vibrating out-of-control. Another second... Sweat pouring from his face, Cappy strains to free his bandaged arm from the tape holding it to his chest. He moves the clumsy bandage towards the strib. Three inches away, it seems like a mile. Cappy struggles, wide-eyed, his hand moving a fraction of an inch further, but shakin so hard he's in danger of knocking the strip from the points. He moves closer. Unable to grasp the strip, Cappy lines up his bandaged hand, aiming at the strip. With the last of his strength he lunges, pushing the strip between the points. Cappy collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, crawling over the seats, pulling himself along, nearly swimming over the passengers, trying to get to the Terrorist in the rear of the plane. The Terrorist gets to his feet, seeing Grant. He levels his weapon but Grant leaps, grabbing the Terrorist, a struggle ensuing for control of the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pressure is now beginning to stabilize as Baker fights his way to his feet. He makes his way to Charlie, lying in the aisle, nearly unconscious. Baker moves through the work station heading for the rear of the plane, but as he steps into the aisle, Ali Hassan smashes Baker across the face with his pistol, knocking him to the floor. In the rear of the plane, Ali Hassan can see the fight in progress between Grant and the Terrorist.  247 124.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, struggling to tear the weapon from the Terrorist's hands. As they spin around, the WEAPON FIRES, a burst ripping through the ceiling. With a final effort, Grant knees the Terrorist in the groin, twice, ripping the weapon free, using it to bludgeon the Terrorist to the floor. Grant falls as well, the weapon flying from his hands, lodging under a seat. Grant, exhausted, nearly sick, struggles to his feet and turns. Facing him is Ali Hassan, his face wild and crazed. He raises his weapon, leveling it at Grant... But his eyes go wide in shock as several SHOTS RING OUT. Blood spurts from Hassan's mouth as he turns and falls, face down. Standing behind him is Fran, Grant's .22 automatic in her hand. She looks at the gun, her hand beginning to tremble. Grant takes the weapon, bending to pick up Ali Hassan's weapon as well. As Grant rolls over the body... Ali laughs, a grenade in his hand. He pulls the pin. Instinctively, Grant lunges, his hand grabbing Ali's, holding it and the grenade handle closed. A desperate struggle ensues, Ali fighting to release the grenade, Grant to keep control of Ali's hand while trying to subdue him. As they slam against the outer bulkhead, Grant looks up, seeing an emergency exit door. Wrestling himself into position, Grant kicks upward with all of his strength, the release handle for the door flying, the door pivoting outward as the emergency slide, in an explosion of air, extends... Grant breaks free, shoving Ali backwards. As Ali flies out the door, making a desperate grab for the slide, he drops the grenade, spoon flying, the grenade wedging in the doorway. Ali, arms entangled in a safety line, is ripped to the end of the slide, flapping wildly in the wind. Grant kicks the grenade, dislodging it from the doorframe the grenade skittering down the slide. Ali screams...

dialogues.speaker: SLIDE
dialogues.text: The 747 in the b.g., the grenade bounding towards him...  248 249 250 251 252 125.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 747
dialogues.text: The yellow slide, Ali clinging to the end like a tail on a kite, disappears in a FIERY EXPLOSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cahill, battered and bruised, climbs INTO VIEW, seeing Cappy, uypside down, the plastic strip in place. Carefully he crawls into the container, and with a pair of wire cutters, clips through the wires at the bottom of the sphere, leading to the points. He finds the com- unit, keying the mike.

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: (to mike; shaking) This is Cahill. The bomb's dismantled. We're safe. Cahill moves alongside Cappy, struggling to push the stretcher out of the container. Gasping, he puts his arm across Cappy's chest, grabbing his hand.

dialogues.speaker: CAHILL
dialogues.text: (exhausted) Cappy, you did it, you did it.

dialogues.speaker: CAPPY
dialogues.text: (smiling) We did it, Cahill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain, still fighting the controls, begins to pull the plane out of its dive. The altimeter reads 3,000 feet as the plane begins to level out.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 747
dialogues.text: Begins to nose upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaplan and his team watching the overhead situation board, indicating the path of the 747 as it begins to gain altitude.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: They're leveling out... gaining altitude, five thousand feet. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: OVER the SPEAKERS, a voice breaks the tension.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Castle Rock, this is Grant. We're in control of the airplane. The bomb has been defused. We need a place to land. Hugging, back-slapping pandemonium spreads through the room like wildfire.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR-GENERAL
dialogues.text: (shouting) Congratulations, Captain. We're diverting you now to Carson Air Force Base. The F-14's will escort you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where an isolated runway is lined with crash trucks and other emergency vehicles. The trucks spraying the field with fire-retardant foam are just completing their work and are leaving the field. All eyes look to the sky. Waiting. OVER the RADIO on one of the Jeeps, we hear the final report from the Air Traffic Control Center.

dialogues.speaker: TRAFFIC CONTROLLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Flight 343, now on final approach. Emergency crews stand-by. Someone points to the horizon. In the red glow of the setting sun, we see the familiar sight of the crippled 747, drifting closer to earth. Moments later, the airborne monster touches down once again, plowing through the foam as the crash trucks close in behind, following it down the runway.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 747
dialogues.text: As the PLANE THUNDERS through the foam, its wheels on solid ground, an incredible, deafening cheer explodes fro every man, woman, and child, the incredible nightmare ordeal, finally at an end.  255 256 127.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 747 sits illuminated by powerful floodlights, attache to special cranes. The area is heavily guarded and sur- rounded by squads of fire trucks, ambulances, military vehicles and a huge, bomb-disposal rig, from which demo- lition experts are unloading with a forklift a huge steel box, into which the bomb will be placed. The cargo doors to the 747 are open and men in EVA suits are entering the plane. The terrorists' bodies, now in body bags are being placed in the bed of a large truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rat, an I.V. attached to his arm, is carried down the aisle by medics. Behind, Cappy is gently moved on his stretcher, Cahill still at his side. As the Air Marshal is lifted INTO VIEW on a stretcher, Grant appears at his side, shaking his hand. The Marshal looks up at Fran.

dialogues.speaker: AIR MARSHAL
dialogues.text: (groggy, sedated) The magazine. Didn't know what you were getting at until I saw his face.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Well, whatever you're talking about, you did the right thing. Tell these guys to take good care of you. The stretcher is removed, Grant turning to Fran.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: FRAN
dialogues.text: Fran. By the way, you've got a hell of a lot of explaining to do.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Let's just say, we came along for the ride. Rest is... classified. An Army CORPORAL appears, handing Grant a black, aluminum suitcase. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CORPORAL
dialogues.text: Captain Grant. They're patching Mr. Kaplan through. (beat) There's also an eyes only' message for Colonel Travis. He looks at Fran, shrugging.

dialogues.speaker: FRAN
dialogues.text: I'll be up front. Grant accepts the case, dropping into a seat. He opens it to reveal a Satellite Communications Unit, containing a scrambler telephone, computer keyboard and screen. Grant turns it on, typing in an access code. On the screen a message appears: EXECUTIVE DECISION. Grant, remembering, reaches in his pocket, retrieving the mag-code strip. He inserts it into the computer. A new message appears: Have prepared bon voyage for Jaffa. Cousin Reggie. Grant hits the enter key, the following appearing:

dialogues.speaker: 04973/WILDFIRE-1.
dialogues.text: Beside him, the gentle BLEEP of the TELEPHONE is heard. He lifts the handset from the black case.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Captain Grant. Yes, go ahead. (line crackles) Yes, Mr. Kaplan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaplan is sitting in an easy chair, a drink at his side. He looks nearly as weary as Grant.

dialogues.speaker: KAPLAN
dialogues.text: I think I can say, Captain, this is a day either of us won't soon forget. (beat) How are the men? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GRANT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (faint) One wounded, one pretty shaken but they're both going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: KAPLAN
dialogues.text: The President personally sends his deepest thanks. I'm sure he will want to meet with you when he returns. We all owe you a great debt, Captain Grant. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 747
dialogues.text: Grant listening to Kaplan.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: KAPLAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We have accomplished a tremendous victory, but our satellite intelligence reports indicate that Jaffa is just now touching down in North Africa. I hate to see that bastard get away. Grant places the black case on his lap and begins to ente something on the keyboard as he talks. On the screen we see:

dialogues.speaker: CODE KEY APPROVED/SECURE LINE READY FOR TRANSMIT.
dialogues.text: Grant types in:

dialogues.speaker: SAT-COM UPLINK/ABLE 666 WILDFIRE-1
dialogues.text: The screen flashes with the data as it is processed.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, I agree. I hate to see the bastard get away. The screen flashes with new information:

dialogues.speaker: READY TO TRANSMIT.
dialogues.text: Grant types in: ACTIVATE: EXECUTIVE DECISION. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The screen flashes: READY TO ACTIVATE: EXECUTIVE DECISION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The executive jet is taxiing into position on a tarmac. In the distance we see that an escort of a dozen vehicles is approaching. The plane rolls to a stop, the cabin door opening.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 747
dialogues.text: Grant is staring at the screen, the words "READY TO ACTIVATE: EXECUTIVE DECISION" holding steady. We HOLD ON his eyes, remembering... He types in: ACTIVATE.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: The Arabs have a saying, 'Those who would bare the torch of the devil, shall be consumed in its flames.' His finger holds over the ENTER key, pausing, a slight tremble of hesitation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaffa appears in the doorway. Seeing the arriving escort, he holds up his arms in a gesture of victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the approaching escort draws nearer, we see Jaffa in the doorway of the jet, his arms raised. In the lead Jeep, a man dressed in desert fatigues stands and raises his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where attached to the airframe are a dozen sticks of C-4 plastic explosive, wired to an electronic transfer box. A tag reads: "Happy Landings, Love and Kisses, Reggie." A RELAY on the box CLICKS...  264 265 266 267 131.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the jet erupts into a gigantic fireball, which lights up the desert sky for miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if seen from a satellite, the expanding fireball racin across the runway, the escort vehicles turning desperatel away.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 747
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Grant's finger as he releases the computer key, the audible CLICK intensified. We GO TO Grant's face. He breathes deeply, the first relaxed breath in many hours. He closes the case and puts his head back, closing his eyes. The mission is over. He gets to his feet, walking down the now empty aircraft. Reaching the doorway, he steps outside, inhaling deeply the cold night air. At the bottom of the ramp, Fran is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 747
dialogues.text: Grant descends the ramp. He looks back at the towering 747, still majestic despite the gaping holes in its side. He turns to Fran.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here. END CREDITS ROLL and we: FADE OUT.
